instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message:
Hi guys,

Got macbook with liquid damage in battery conector area. Cleaned it, changed some componentes and now it starts and work all ok except of battery. Not chargin it.


Checked <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and 27/28 pins have 20 ohms but 17/18 is going to millions ohms. Already changed <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> with no result.


PPBUS ( with only magsafe conecting is 14V than going down untill 2.8V and again 14V and all time like this. When the battery is connected 13.65V stable. 

3V42 is present but a little high ( 4V).


My bet is that SMC is bad, but want to ask before changing that shit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message:
Does it recognize the battery just not charge it? If so, your problem is pins 17/18 NOT the SMC!!!! One of the following is true:

1. <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2 is blown or both.
2. <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> is blown (less likely, but possible)
3. The traces between the ISL and <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2 are blown or between <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2 and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>. 

Also why did you change <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>? Was it liquid damaged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message:
Sorry, i mean <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> not <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. It was liquid damage that area.

<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 are ok with continuity, <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: it detects battery and works from battery, also detecting charger, but doesnt charge.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: So your problem is pins 17/18 is it 2.9 ohms or millions still? If all check good, then your problem is the ISL it seems.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: Changed it again ( third time) and still not connected magsafe but yes, it is going to millions ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: So one of the few has to be true above there is no way all the resistors are ok and the traces. That's literally not possible unless you're measuring the wrong spot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: will check it again tomorrow. May be I missed some traces but Resistor are ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message:
You've been asked about resistance between pins, not to ground; 17-18 and 27-28, in ohm scale.
Confirm if did that.

Disconnect battery, use only original Magsafe 1 60/85W charger.
Post voltage for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, pins 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17/18, 19, 20, 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message:
Yes, it is between pins not to ground. Between 27/28 23ohms and between 17/18 7Mohms

Pin:

2 - 20V
3 - 4.8V
9/12/13/14 - 4.1V
15 - 0.06V
17/18 - 14V than down until 2.5V and become again 14 Volts. And same cycle all time
19/20 - 6.1 V
27/28 - 20V and like 17/18 going down until 6V and than 20V again.


Almost all rails that seems to be stable have some variations 0,3V up down constantly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message:
"between 17/18 7Mohms"
Your issue is more than clear; solve that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: Something strange is happening. <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_INRUSH</SIGNAL> is going up to 36 V when magsafe is connected and i connect the battery without booting logic board. :S <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> recieves 20V and gies 36V. IS that the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message:
Did you try other multimeter?

Why you do NOT do what we ask to do???
Solve <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 issue!!!
If resistors are OK, then rebuild corroded traces...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: If you cannot do what we say, then we cannot help you....between pins 17/18 you should have 3.9 ohms of resistance. If <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2 measure 2.2 and 0 and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> measure 0, then you have a break in the line find it....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: Sorry, you both were right. It was trace between <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> PIN 2 and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> Pin 3. Now i have 3ohms on 17/18, but still not charging battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: What voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> currently charger only?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turning on, green light, no orange not charging.
threads.message: Solved. Changins ISL. Seems it was burning every time i put new one while there was damaged trace. Thank you very much:)
